enrichment.AboutCourse:
The course structure is predominately school based with additional Professional Study training days.  Trainees are allocated a 'host school' but will also spend time in a second ('complementary') school.  Each trainee will be directly supervised by a school based Mentor.  This specially trained Mentor will organise such matters as school timetables, observe lessons, set targets and provide feedback to the trainee in regular progress meetings.  Additionally, each school has a Professional Tutor who maintains overall responsibility for all the trainees in that school.  The Professional Tutor will also be able to support the trainee and can organise additional training opportunities.\r
\r
Right from the start of the programme our trainees spend time in schools, including Royal Wootton Bassett Academy (home of the North Wiltshire SCITT), learning about various aspects of education.  After the initial induction period the trainees begin their own teaching practice in the first of two school placements, where they will begin by observing classes and working alongside the class teacher.  Over time this will progress to team-teaching and small group teaching.  Later in this initial placement trainees should be looking to take on responsibility for entire classes and be planning whole lessons or even a sequence of lessons.  As a guide, throughout the academic year trainees can expect to begin by following a 40% teaching timetable, which will gradually increase to a minimum of 80% by the end of the year.  By this point trainees should be developing high level teaching skills (planning, teaching and evaluating extending sequences of lessons and assessing students' progress).\r
\r
During the programme trainees will also spend time undertaking Professional Study sessions and Subject Specialist sessions at either Royal Wootton Bassett Academy or at one of our partner schools.\r
\r
In addition to the two main school placements, trainees will have experience of a school out of the phase they are training for.  This is where primary trainees gain an understanding of secondary education and secondary trainees gain an understanding of primary education.  Also, an opportunity to experience an international context may be possible.  There may also be an opportunity for trainees to experience education in an alternative setting if this is deemed appropriate or if a trainee expresses a desire to gain such experience.\r
enrichment.Qualifications:
\r
There are certain academic requirements trainees must have achieved before applying for teacher training:-\r
\r
Degree : A UK degree or an approved equivalent qualification.  For secondary trainees this must be in, or closely related to, your proposed teaching subject.  We would expect that at least 50% of your degree is in the subject you wish to teach.  We typically look for a degree classification of 2:2 or higher.  You must also have Grade C/Level 4 or above in GCSE English Language, Maths and Science or an approved equivalent qualification.
enrichment.FinancialSupport: You may be eligable for a student loan or maintenance grant.  Full details can be found at www.SLC.co.uk.
enrichment.InterviewProcess: Interviews will be held at regular intervals starting in November.  The school based interview process will include a number of activities such as a pupil panel interview, a self-reflection task and a formal interview with senior staff and subject leaders.
enrichment.OtherRequirements:
You  need to have passed the Professional Skills Tests prior to starting the course.  You are encouraged to register for and pass the Skills Tests as soon as possible and you can apply to take these once you have applied for a course via UCAS.  \r
\r
You will be required to complete a satisfactory medical report to show you meet the standards for 'Fitness to Teach'.\r
\r
You must complete an Enhanced Disclosure from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS).  In addition you will be required to disclose any previous criminal record to the North Wiltshire SCITT, including spent and unspent convictions.  \r
\r
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
In addition to the formal entry requirements, it is an expectation that some form of school experience has been undertaken.  Although we do not require it, 2 weeks is advisable before starting your training.\r
\r
Our successful applicants should be able to show that they are flexible and show initiative.  We want inspirational trainees who are commited to education.  You'll need to be a confident communicator with a sense of humour and perspective.  A strong subject knowledge and good use of time is useful.  You'll need to remain calm and focused under pressure and join in as a team player. \r
\r
\r
\r
\r
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork: We have over 30 partnership school, both secondary and primary,  across Wiltshire and beyond that also offer placements to our trainees.    Our Primary Training programme is also linked with Pickwick TSA.  Some of the central training for our Primary trainees will take place in Corsham.  When placing our trainees, we look at their subject, location and the requirements of the school.  Ideally, we try to place you within a 30 minute commute.  During the training year, you will have 2 school placements as well as the opportunity to visit alternative phase schools and Special schools.

inst.TrainWithUs:
North Wiltshire SCITT is an Outstanding Provider, awarded by Ofsted in 2017.  Our vision is to produce outstanding teachers who will ensure their students, whatever their starting point, thrive in all aspects of education. Our trainee teachers will value developing the whole person equally to the achievement of academic success.\r
The North Wiltshire SCITT provides Initial Teaching Training (ITT) for the North Wiltshire area and beyond.  We are based at the Teacher Education Centre next to Royal Wootton Bassett Academy.  We offer ITT programmes leading to Qualified Teacher Status (QTS) and Post Graduate Certificate in Education (PGCE) which includes 60 masters credits, in both the Primary and Secondary fields of education.  We recommend for QTS qualification and our accrediting Higher Education Institute for PGCE qualification is Bath Spa University.\r
We aim to deliver high quality initial teacher training using North Wiltshire SCITT partnership schools and expertise within our Teaching School Alliance.  Training is delivered by current, outstanding practitioners.   Each trainee will be challenged to become the best classroom practitioner they can possibly be.  Trainees should aim to become confident, competent and reflective practitioners who are capable of delivering consistently good or outstanding lessons.  In turn, they should want to produce the very best learning opportunities for all their students.  Guidance and support is available throughout the programme for all our trainees and we support individual needs where appropriate.\r
inst.TrainWithDisability:
We are an inclusive organisation. All potential applicants are considered on an equal basis. \r
\r
We will ensure that all candidates applying and securing a place to train with us will be provided, wherever possible, with the means to do so, by implementing reasonable adjustments as required which may include:\r
\r
-Ensuring access to training venues and schools\r
-Providing additional time where required e.g. for PGCE assignments\r
-Providing larger print and/or coloured paper\r
-Additional support from School-based mentor / Teaching and Learning tutor\r
-Ensuring all placement schools and venues are aware of any allergies and intolerances\r
-Ensuring that candidates with hearing and/or sight impairments are seated appropriately to facilitate access to presentation content and instructions.\r
\r
Please make us aware of any disabilities or other needs. We can assure you that all information will be treated in complete confidence.\r
